channel.title: My Old Kentucky Blog
channel.description: a music blog that parties with unicorns

item.title: Kickstarter Spotlight : Good Graeff : Better Half EP
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Good Graeff acoustic folk pop duo of twins Brooke and Brittany Graeff. The two formed the project when they were just 16 years old in Florida. Bucking the trends of most twins, they both went their separate way with Brooke heading off to Canada and Brittany to Europe. MP3: Good Graeff – [...]
item.content:encoded:
Good Graeff acoustic folk pop duo of twins Brooke and Brittany Graeff. The two formed the project when they were just 16 years old in Florida. Bucking the trends of most twins, they both went their separate way with Brooke heading off to Canada and Brittany to Europe.

MP3: Good Graeff – Hold Me Fast

Last year, the two reunited in Vietnam and immediately started playing music together again for an outlet with no intentions of it turning into anything serious. However, after their neighbors heard the duo, they were asked to play a party and received positive praise.

The girls now are heavy into a Kickstarter campaign to help fund their EP and upcoming tour. Right now, they are approximately $1400 away from their $10000 goal with just a little under three day remaining. Head over to their Kickstarter page and support this promising project with any amount you can scrounge together big or small. As they say, every little bit counts.

item.title: Song : Dark Dark Dark : “What I Needed”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Coming on the heels of their much lauded album, Who Needs Who, Minneapolis’ Dark Dark Dark will be getting involved in the Record Store Day festivities with the release of a new EP, What I Needed, featuring three new songs. Recorded during the sessions of their latest album and in the aftermath of a [...]
item.content:encoded:
Coming on the heels of their much lauded album, Who Needs Who, Minneapolis’ Dark Dark Dark will be getting involved in the Record Store Day festivities with the release of a new EP, What I Needed, featuring three new songs. Recorded during the sessions of their latest album and in the aftermath of a relationship breakdown between band co-founders Marshall LaCount and Nona Marie Invie, the band felt these songs deserved their own place seperate of the full-length. Listen to the title track of the EP below. The song has a very 60s, girl group quality about it.

Tour Dates:
May 8 – Brugge, BE @ Cactus Club
May 9 – Rotterdam, NL @ Rotown
May 10-Sun.-May 12 – Camber Sands, UK @ All Tomorrow’s Parties (curated by TV on the Radio)
May 13 – Antwerp, BE @ Trix

May 21 – Ravenna, IT @ Hana-Bi
May 23 – Düdingen, CH @ Kilibi Festival

item.title: Video : Wavves : “Demon To Lean On”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Wavves released their new album, Afraid of Heights, today via Mom + Pop/Warner Bros. To celebrate the occassion, the band released a new video for “Demon To Lean On”, directed by BLACK // DOCTOR (Chris Black and MISTERDOCTOR). The video sees a car getting towed to a junkyard with a boy sleeping inside [...]
item.content:encoded:
Wavves released their new album, Afraid of Heights, today via Mom + Pop/Warner Bros. To celebrate the occassion, the band released a new video for “Demon To Lean On”, directed by BLACK // DOCTOR (Chris Black and MISTERDOCTOR). The video sees a car getting towed to a junkyard with a boy sleeping inside it. The boy ends up getting pulled into a whole society of people who are making the junkyard their home. Check it out below.

Tour Dates:
03-27 Denver, CO – Larimer Lounge *

item.title: Song : Pure X : “Someone Else”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Cinematic, gloomy, emotional could all be appropriate in describing the latest song, “Someone Else”, from Austin, TX trio Pure X. The song will appear on their forthcoming album, Crawling Up The Stairs, slated for release on May 14th via Acéphale. The rawness of this track cuts to the bone with every screech and [...]
item.content:encoded:
Cinematic, gloomy, emotional could all be appropriate in describing the latest song, “Someone Else”, from Austin, TX trio Pure X. The song will appear on their forthcoming album, Crawling Up The Stairs, slated for release on May 14th via Acéphale. The rawness of this track cuts to the bone with every screech and crack of the voice. Listen below.

MP3: Pure X – Someone Else

Previous:

item.title: Song : Kurt Vile : “Never Run Away”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: As we discussed last month, Kurt Vile will be releasing his new album, Wakin on a Pretty Daze, on April 9th via Matador. You’ve heard the excellent somewhat title track “Wakin on a Pretty Day”, now we get another cut titled “Never Run Away”. As always with Vile, there is no flash or [...]
item.content:encoded:
As we discussed last month, Kurt Vile will be releasing his new album, Wakin on a Pretty Daze, on April 9th via Matador. You’ve heard the excellent somewhat title track “Wakin on a Pretty Day”, now we get another cut titled “Never Run Away”. As always with Vile, there is no flash or unexpected trajectory in the sound, just good ‘ol rock and roll. You can find the download below along with the introductory video he did for the song.

MP3: Kurt Vile – Never Run Away

item.title: [WIN THIS!] : Two Tickets to see Grizzly Bear in Louisville, KY : April 1st
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: We love giving away free stuff to our readers, so when we found out that Grizzly Bear was going to be doing a show our old stomping grounds of Louisville, KY, we knew we had to get a hold of a couple tickets to give away. In addition to Grizzly Bear, the always great [...]
item.content:encoded: We love giving away free stuff to our readers, so when we found out that Grizzly Bear was going to be doing a show our old stomping grounds of Louisville, KY, we knew we had to get a hold of a couple tickets to give away. In addition to Grizzly Bear, the always great Owen Pallett will be handling opening duties. To enter, all you need to do is “like” MOKB on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. After doing this, just give us a shout on Twitter with the hashtag #grizzlybearlouisville. We will select a winner on Friday, March 29th. If you don’t want to leave your the tickets to chance, you can purchase them here.

item.title: MOKB Premiere : Wickerbird : “Fay Warer”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Mt. Rainier, WA folk artist Blake Cowan, known under the stage name Wickerbird, will be releasing his new EP, The Westering, tomorrow. The EP follow-up his solid debut album, The Crow Mother, released in the fall of last year. All of his songs have a spiritual or hymnal quality about them that bridges [...]
item.content:encoded: Mt. Rainier, WA folk artist Blake Cowan, known under the stage name Wickerbird, will be releasing his new EP, The Westering, tomorrow. The EP follow-up his solid debut album, The Crow Mother, released in the fall of last year. All of his songs have a spiritual or hymnal quality about them that bridges the gap between humanity and God. His music couldn’t be a more perfect soundtrack for the winter that just won’t seem to go away at the moment. To get you started on his latest EP, we have the gentle and ethereal “Fay Warer”. You can grab the EP and his previous releases at his Bandcamp. Listen below.

item.title: New Band Smell : St. Paul and the Broken Bones
item.dc:creator: Dodge
item.category: St. Paul and the Broken Bones
item.description: White boys got soul. Had a couple friends bring St. Paul and the Broken Bones to my attention while I was down at SXSW this year. Glad I followed up. You now reap the rewards. St. Paul and crew are from Birmingham, Alabama, and make some beautiful, southern soul music. Paul was [...]
item.content:encoded:
White boys got soul. Had a couple friends bring St. Paul and the Broken Bones to my attention while I was down at SXSW this year. Glad I followed up. You now reap the rewards. St. Paul and crew are from Birmingham, Alabama, and make some beautiful, southern soul music. Paul was raised on southern church music and actually groomed to be a preacher. Lucky for all of us, we now get to be his congregation.

St. Paul and the Broken Bones perform “Broken Bones and Pocket Change” with Shaker Steps in the Lexington Center, which is attached to the hallowed grounds of the University of Kentucky’s Rupp Arena. Yes, yes, I already know my Cats could use a little church these days.

St. Paul and the Broken Bones on Facebook | Bandcamp

item.title: Song : Dinosaur Jr. : “Entertainment” (Phoenix Cover)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Everybody is waiting for the release of Phoenix’s fifth studio album, Bankrupt!, on April 23rd via Glassnote. We already heard the upbeat lead single “Entertainment” and now indie-rock legends Dinosaur Jr. decided to put their own little spin on the song with amazing results. Their version takes the song to the other end [...]
item.content:encoded: Everybody is waiting for the release of Phoenix’s fifth studio album, Bankrupt!, on April 23rd via Glassnote. We already heard the upbeat lead single “Entertainment” and now indie-rock legends Dinosaur Jr. decided to put their own little spin on the song with amazing results. Their version takes the song to the other end of the spectrum with slow burn and wailing guitar solo only Dinosaur Jr. can provide. Dare we say this is better than the original. Find it below along with the original.
